content:
HBO Max is a highly anticipated streaming service that's generating a lot of buzz. Here are the details you're looking for:

**Launch Date:** HBO Max is set to launch on **May 27, 2020**, in the United States.

**Pricing:** The service will cost **$14.99 per month**, which is the same price as the existing HBO Now service. However, HBO Max will offer a much larger content library, including a vast collection of TV shows, movies, and original content.

**Content:** HBO Max will feature a massive library of content, including:

* The entire HBO catalog, including popular shows like Game of Thrones, Westworld, and The Sopranos
* A vast collection of WarnerMedia content, including TV shows and movies from Warner Bros., TBS, TNT, and Cartoon Network
* Exclusive original content, including new shows and movies produced specifically for HBO Max
* A selection of popular TV shows and movies from other networks and studios

**Features:**

* HBO Max will offer a user-friendly interface with personalized recommendations and profiles
* The service will be available on a variety of devices, including smartphones, tablets, smart TVs, and streaming devices like Roku and Chromecast
* HBO Max will support 4K Ultra HD and HDR (High Dynamic Range) streaming on compatible devices

**Promotions:** To attract new subscribers, HBO Max is offering a few promotions:

* Existing HBO Now subscribers will be able to upgrade to HBO Max at no additional cost
* New subscribers can sign up for a 7-day free trial before committing to a paid subscription
* Some AT&T customers will receive HBO Max as part of their existing plans or bundles

Keep in mind that HBO Max will be a separate service from HBO Now, and subscribers will need to sign up for the new service to access the expanded content library.
